p.s: The novel The Hate U Give written by Angie Thomas published by Cornelsen in 2019 tells the story about the young teenage girl Starr Carter.

The book deals with important topics such as Black Lives Matter, Police Brutalitypolice brutality, Injusticeinjustice and Social Actionssocial actions but also The Power of Languagethe power of language and identity.
After Starr sees her best friend Khalil get shot by a police officer and him not getting arrested she wants to speak up and make a change.
In Chapterchapter 24 pp. 328-332 Starr drives with her brother past the place Khalil got killed.
There are many people protesting against the decision that the police officer who killed Khalil didn't get arrested.
As Starr wants to make a change, she speaks up.
In the first part of this scene Starr remembers the night of Khalil's murder as they see people protesting.
Afterwards she recognizes Ms. Ofrah her attorney standing on a police car talking to the crowd.
Everyone keeps repeating a sentence while protesting even though the police tells them to leave.
As Starr screemsscreams Ms. Ofrah recognizes her and askasks Starr what she is doing there.
Ms. OfrahaskasksStarr if she really wants to speak up and make a change which Starr answers with yes.
So she climbs on the top of a car with the bullhorn and talks to the crowd just as Ms. Ofrah did.
First she's scared but then she witnesses that she is the one who saw what happened to Khalil and that they won't stop protesting until something changes.
In the end she says that the protest isn't about Khalil's deaddeath it is about his life.
To summsum a situation where Starr speaks up in the first time live infrontin front of police officers and the people in Garden Heights.
